UPLIFTMENT OF EDUCATION IN PLANTATION SECTOR: MEASURES TAKEN 385/18 7. ( ) (The Hon. Mahindananda Aluthgamage) - (2):

(i) whether he acknowledges that there has been a collapse in the education of children of workers living in the plantation sector though there has been a development in the education of rural schools;
(ii) the measures taken during the previous regime from 2010 to 2014 to uplift the education of schools in the plantation sector;
(iii) the amount of money spent on that;
(iv) the number of teachers recruited during that period for that purpose; and

(b) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Akila Viraj Kariyawasam) , .

: : TELECASTING VISUALS OF DRINKING ALCOHOL OR SMOKING: PROHIBITION 476/18 10. ... ( ... ) (The Hon. D.T.W. Wimalaweera Dissanayaka) (3):

askd the Minister of Finance and Mass Media: (a) Is he aware that telecasting teledramas, films or advertisements with visuals of drinking alcohol or smoking is prohibited in terms of National Authority on Tobacco and Alcohol Act, No. 27 of 2006? (b) Will he admit that- (i) if so, on episode of the Swetha Gantheera teledrama telecast on Independent Television Network controlled by the Ministry of Mass Media between 7.30 p.m. and 8.00 p.m. on 11.02.2017 showed very clearly an actress was smoking; (ii) such scenes, specially scenes of women smoking might be a stimulation for smoking; and (iii) government controlled media institution has violated the provisions of an Act passed by Parliament?
(c) Will he inform this House whether a formal investigation would be conducted on that episode of the teledrama and steps taken to prevent such things from happening in future?
(d) If not, why? ( ) ( - ) The Hon. Lasantha Alagiyawanna - Deputy Minister of Finance and Mass Media) , .

II RECOGNITION OF NURSING DEGREE COURSE OFFERED BY UNIVERSITY OF JAFFNA

() ( ) ( () - ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe - (Minister of Higher Education and Cultural Affairs) Hon. Deputy Speaker, the first question raised by the Hon. Douglas Devananda is whether there is any obstacle with regard to registration of students who have completed the Degree Courses in Nursing. There is no such obstacle. Registration is not a matter for the University. Earlier there was a different structure. All those who completed the Nursing Courses had to be registered in the Ceylon Medical College Council. A few years later, that system was changed and a new institution was established. That is the Sri Lanka Nurses Council.

Therefore, all the steps that have to be taken by the university had been taken. In fact, representation had been made to the Sri Lanka Nurses Council, with regard to registration of those students. But the Sri Lanka Nurses Council is not an entity which comes within the purview of the Minister of Higher Education. That comes under the Ministry of Health. According to the information I have so far obtained - I am not certain about the correctness of it- at the moment there is a delay in the work of Sri Lanka Nurses Council as a result of a tug-of-war by two trade unions claiming that the Council had not been properly constituted. It is a matter to be resolved by the Ministry of Health and we will certainly inform the Minister of Health to take immediate action. I think that covers the first and the second questions.

With regard to the third question, Hon. Deputy Speaker, during the last few years, we have spent so much of money for provision of infrastructure facilities. In the year 2014, for the Jaffna University, we have spent Rs. 1,140 million; in 2015, Rs. 843 million; in 2016, Rs. 2,040 million; in 2017, Rs. 2,482 million and in 2018, Rs. 2,019 million. Altogether within this five-year period, Hon. Deputy Speaker, we have spent, Rs. 8,524 million for the development of Jaffna University.

In addition to that, as the Hon. Member is aware during the last 70-year period, in the State Universities governed by the University Grants Commission, there were hostel facilities for 56,000 out of the student population of 90,000. In fact I must appreciate the services rendered by my predecessor Hon. Lakshman Kiriella. During the last two years, he had initiated a programme to put up 84 hostels all over the country. As a result, by the end of this year, we are adding facilities for another 33,600 students. For the last 70 years, it was only for 56,000 and during these two years we have been able to provide hostel facilities for 33,600 students. Our student population is 91,000 but with this programme there will be hostel facilities for 89,000 students. And in the Jaffna University, there are 10 hostel buildings and after completion of the new building, we will be able to accommodate 4,000 students.

There is no lapse or any deficiency on the part of the Minister of Higher Education or the University Grants Commission. We have taken all the measures with regard to registration of students. Not only the Jaffna University but there are other universities also which have faculties for Nursing and Allied Sciences. This problem may crop up in those universities also unless it is resolved by the Minister of Health.
Than you very much. ( ) (The Hon. Deputy Speaker) 27(2) . . ( ) (The Hon. Anura Dissanayake) . , ? ( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) . ( ) (The Hon. Anura Dissanayake) , .

SITTINGS OF THE PARLIAMENT ( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) Sir, I move, "That notwithstanding the provisions of the Standing Order No. 8 of the Parliament, the hours of Sitting of Parliament on this day shall be 1.00 p.m. to 7.30 p.m.. At 2.00 p.m. Standing Order No. 8(5) of the Parliament shall operate. At 7.30 p.m. Mr. Speaker shall adjourn the Parliament without question put." , . . Question put, and agreed to. ( ) (The Hon. Presiding Member) The next speaker is the Hon. S. Shritharan. You have 20 minutes.

( ) (The Hon. Namal Rajapaksa) Sir, I rise to a point of Order. ( ) (The Hon. Presiding Member) Hon. Member, there is a point of Order being raised by the Hon. Namal Rajapaksa. ( ) (The Hon. Namal Rajapaksa) Hon. Member, can I have one minute to ask you a question?

. ( . ) (The Hon. S. Shritharan) , , , - ( ) (The Hon. Namal Rajapaksa) Sir, I rise to a point of Order. ( ) (The Hon. Presiding Member) Hon. Member, there is a point of Order being raised by the Hon. Namal Rajapaksa. ( ) (The Hon. Namal Rajapaksa) Hon. Member, you were talking about the prisoners in the Magazine Prison. Now, what steps have you have taken with regard to them? Yesterday, we saw a former State Minister getting bail within half-an-hour. But, what have you done with regard to the release of these prisoners so far? We remember, during the last Presidential Election, you went to the North promising to get bail for those people. But, what have you all done so far, for the last four-and-a-half years, to help them? You only complain, but you have not done anything. . ( . ) (The Hon. S. Shritharan) , ! . , , . ? , 12,000 . . , - ( ) (The Hon. Namal Rajapaksa) Sir, I rise to a point of Order. ( ) (The Hon. Presiding Member) Hon. Member, there is a point of Order being raised by the Hon. Namal Rajapaksa. ( ) (The Hon. Namal Rajapaksa) Hon. Member, we are happy that you are blaming the

Government for this. You all communicate with the Government regarding the rest of the problems, but have you spoken about this matter? We know that you go and meet those people, talk about this problem. But when you come back and meet the Government officials you say something else. So, what have you done? I know it personally because I was in the remand prison with them. . ( . ) (The Hon. S. Shritharan) , , , . , . , . , . " " . ( ) (The Hon. Namal Rajapaksa) Hon. Member, I do not want to argue with you. ( ) (The Hon. Presiding Member) That is not a point of Order, Hon. Member. ( ) (The Hon. Namal Rajapaksa) Sir, just a clarification. The Hon. Member is talking about rehabilitation. We have rehabilitated 12,500 ex-LTTE cadres and 3,500 of them were employed in the Sri Lanka Civil Security Force. But, what have you all done? You all changed our Government for this. That is my question. I am not going to argue with you, but I want an answer from you. . ( . ) (The Hon. S. Shritharan) , . ; . ! , ! ! ! . . - ? , ;
